occupation: Director of Product at Grounded Solutions Network
headline: Director of Product at Grounded Solutions Network
summary:
I'm an impact-driven professional focused on providing technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills to lead strategic, innovative organizations by delivering quality technology products. My passion is bringing people together to leverage their strengths for maximum collective impact. 

I received a Bachelor's degree in Political Science from Case Western Reserve University with minors in Japanese, Electronics, and Mathematics, and have held certifications in Homeownership Counseling, Foreclosure Prevention Counseling, and VITA/TCE Site Administration.

experiences.title: Director of Product
experiences.description:
Leading product strategy of Grounded Solutions’ signature technology product, HomeKeeper, a Salesforce App designed for homeownership and housing counseling programs. Under my leadership, overall user base and revenue grew by 50% over three years, allowing for our product to secure sufficient revenue to cover expenses for the first time in HomeKeeper’s history. Manage a team of 4 staff, spanning product management, CRM administration, training & support, and marketing & outreach.

Maintaining and improving HomeKeeper’s National Data Hub, a systematic aggregation of performance evaluation data from HomeKeeper participating organizations, working closely with research department to analyze performance data providing strategic insights to organizations and sector wide impact reports.

Overseeing Grounded Solutions’ technology operations, including Salesforce administration, Eurekos Learning Management system, Managed IT Services, cyber security, productivity tech stack and impact data infrastructure. Drive technology success through collaborative implementations of technology products with an integrated, human centered, and continuous development approach.

Participating in impact data standardization and homeownership collaboratives, including the Housing Counseling MISMO Workgroup, Black Homeownership Collaborative, and Washington State Community Land Trust Data Standards.

experiences.title: Assistant Director of Strategic Innovation
experiences.description:
Led Salesforce CRM implementation, budgeting, and support for 9 lines of business, 116 users with a team of 2, including HUD counseling, homebuyer readiness, energy conservation, lead abatement, crisis assistance, fundraising, and others, using the HomeKeeper CMS and other customizations. Modernized data infrastructure and integration across multiple data platforms, including Salesforce, SQL and others.

Led CARES Act response implementation, approving and disbursing $9+ million in aid. Developed end to end infrastructure from online application to check payment, across multiple lines of business and partnerships internal and external

experiences.title: Assistant Director of Research and Evaluation
experiences.description:
Developed economic mobility based integrated service delivery model through detailed process mapping and human centered behavioral design, aligning lines of business towards a common goal of maximizing program impact.

800 participants collectively saved $100,000, eliminated $1.5 million derogatory debt, increased credit scores by a median value of 40

experiences.title: Special Projects Manager
experiences.description:
Led federally funded Broadband Technology Opportunity Program to enable digital inclusion for 10,000+ residents. 

Managed team of 15 instructors, 3 supervisors, 40+ volunteers.

Ran largest tax site in Ohio: 7,945 returns, $11.5 million in refunds

accomplishment_projects.title: CHN's Neighborhood Intranet
accomplishment_projects.description:
Project Description:
In 2019, our incoming Executive Director needed a space to convey his vision and connect staff to our mission and each other. We recognized that staff worked in silos and lacked awareness as to how their individual efforts fit as part of the bigger picture.
Objectives:
	Drive company-wide engagement and encourage staff to adopt a “one CHN” approach, using a virtual intranet as the vehicle
	Identify platforms that keep content management with business and drive engagement
Key Results:
	Led efforts to brand the intranet as CHN’s Neighborhood with staff as neighbors, and spaces that represent business lines as neighborhood institutions, such as the Library, City Hall, Town Hall, and Community Center
	In partnership with Human Resources and IT, selected and deployed Atlassian’s platform for its ease of managing content and project management features

accomplishment_projects.title: CDFI Lending Software Standup
accomplishment_projects.description:
CDFI Lending Software | May 2019 – Present
Project Description:
In 2019, CHN obtained its license to offer residential mortgages in underserved markets. The initiative required expertise to balance Real Estate Sales operations, strict federal compliance standards, and technology infrastructure needs.
Objectives:
	Procure, install and configure loan origination and loan servicing software
	Develop a customer-facing website for marketing, loan applications and servicing
Key Results:
	Completed installation and configuration of industry-leading Calyx Loan Origination and Finastra Servicing Director, enabling CHN to close its first loan on schedule
	Leading design, development, and hosting plan for CHN Housing Capital’s website

accomplishment_projects.title: Service Integration
accomplishment_projects.description:
Project Description:
A key component of CHN’s current strategic plan is to maximize client impact, integrating the diverse set of services we offer to the community, utilizing the Salesforce CRM platform to provide a 360-degree, holistic view of our customers. As a result of successful deployment, we were able to add an Operations Analyst to the team in 2019.
Objectives:
	Conduct a comprehensive analysis of each business line to create a shared intake model that improves customer service and staff efficiency within client-facing programs
	Establish a corporate standard for project management and team collaboration to successfully execute initiatives that align with our strategic goals
	Implement a solutions-oriented service delivery model to collect baseline metrics and assess financial stability of our clients, enabling us to measure our success
Key Results:
	Completed business analysis and developed Salesforce applications for our Financial Counseling, Utility Assistance, Energy Conservation, and Real Estate Sales programs, capturing 25,000+ unique services within the new platform
	Introduced a product management, continuous development approach to ensure lines of business are able to receive support to maintain and improve their applications
	Within a working group comprised of company-wide leadership, built consensus on shared data standards, assessments, and relationship management. We developed a service delivery model to collect longitudinal client data, improve staff efficiencies through information sharing, and drive positive outcomes in partnership with clients, modeled after our Family Success Program (see Previous Projects, upon request).

accomplishment_projects.title: Family Success Program
accomplishment_projects.description:
Project Description:
A key component of CHN’s first strategic plan was deeper engagement with residents in our affordable housing units. CHN wanted to strengthen its relationship with its low income families to better understand the drivers and barriers to upward economic mobility and prepare families for a successful and sustainable transition from renter to home owner. 
Objectives:
	Identify communication channels to maintain long term engagement with residents 
	In partnership with residents, develop shared objectives and complementary metrics to measure their economic progress
	Cultivate partnerships to adopt best practices and widen our scope of impact
Key Results:
	Coordinated financial check-up sessions during existing lease renewal sessions, providing a more comprehensive and constructive touch point
	With mortgage readiness as the shared objective, focused on credit, debt, and savings as metrics. Of the 800+ residents participating in the program, clients have collectively saved over $100,000 towards their down payments, eliminated over $1,500,000 in derogatory debt, and increased credit scores by an average of 50 points
	Leveraged technical assistance grants to implement behavioral economics and credit building principles to research rent payment behavior, implement tweaks to influence on-time rent payments, and rent reporting to build credit history

accomplishment_projects.title: Connect Your Community
accomplishment_projects.description:
Project Description:
Federally funded Broadband Technology Opportunity Program with a budget of $18.1 million nationwide across 8 cities, with $3.2 Million budgeted for the City of Cleveland. As the lead agency for the partnership with 5 other Local Community organizations, delivered digital literacy training to drive broadband adoption with a staff of 15 instructors. 
Objectives:
	Train and equip 5,200 low income households with broadband internet access
	Cultivate key partnerships to provide training, low cost computers and internet access
Key Results:
	Trained and equipped 7,000+ households with broadband internet access 
	Forged lasting partnerships by creating shared outcomes with Mobile Citizen to resell 1,000+ affordable, broadband units, RET3 to deliver 7,000+ refurbished machines for participants and Cleveland Metropolitan School district as part of parent engagement

volunteer_work.title: Grants Making Committee Member
volunteer_work.description: Review grant proposals from grassroots organizations that improve community based connections. Interviewed residents and made funding decisions based on funder criteria.

volunteer_work.title: Board Member
volunteer_work.description: Connected Insights was formed to increase access to research and evaluation services and improve how non-profit organizations demonstrate impact
